Everyone has been vaccinated against rabies in the past.
The doctor is urging people to get rabies shots with their pets and to avoid touching the saliva of animals that may be infected.
Rabies is not only transmitted by dogs, but also by cats and bats.

Fukui Prefecture Fukui City Oda 2-chome: Family customers love the cute expressions
In the food service industry in Fukui Prefecture, where there is a shortage of workers, the introduction of delivery robots that bring food to the table is becoming widespread.
It is said that the robots are popular with families because they are useful for streamlining operations and preventing the spread of the new coronavirus, as well as having a friendly appearance.
A restaurant owner and others said, "It is difficult to secure employees and part-time workers at local restaurants, and the use of meal delivery robots will further increase."
"Jin, Jin, Jingisukan ♪".
A robot with a cat's face on the screen plays light music as it glides through the store with a tray of food.
When the customer arrives at the table, they say things like "I've brought your food, nyaa."
In August 2022, "Iwashio Yakusen Jingisukan Bon Fukui Station Store" in Daito 2-chome, Fukui City, introduced a cat-shaped meal delivery robot.
When a customer orders a dish, a robot waiting near the kitchen will load the dish onto a tray and drive to the table with the number on the screen.
It is equipped with AI (artificial intelligence) voice function, and reacts when touched by customers, and the cat face on the screen also has a variety of expressions.
The "Bontagroup" that operates the same store has introduced a meal delivery robot at two stores including this store.

Shakai Chairman Shakai Shoji said that the reason for the introduction was "the biggest shortage of labor," and emphasized that it was part of the efforts to improve productivity through labor-saving and digital transformation (DX).
The ratio of labor costs to sales is usually around 30%, but it has been reduced to 21-22% by the introduction of the system.

Robots also have the role of collecting dishes that have been eaten by customers, which contributes to the efficiency of cleanup, and adds "family-friendly and child-friendly, and it also has a promotional effect."
The "Rokkan Hoshiyama Fukui" restaurant, which is located in Shinboucho, Fukui City, and serves grilled meat and hormone stew, also introduced a meal delivery robot in August 2022.

Hoshiyama Eifuku, president of Sonzan store, said, "I thought it was absolutely necessary to introduce it because I couldn't find employees or part-time workers even though I was recruiting them. I thought it was necessary to solve the shortage of manpower."
At the Fukui store, employees and robots are used in different areas, such as the area where employees serve food and the area where robots deliver food.
The rental fee of robots is the same as the wage of one part-time worker.
In order to reduce the number of people, the restaurant is considering introducing a tablet ordering system and self-service refrigerators in addition to robots.

According to the Fukui Prefectural Labor Bureau, the effective recruitment ratio of job categories in December 2022 was 6.94 times for "customer service" in restaurants and other industries, which is a job category with a high shortage of workers.

The person in charge of the network system (Komaki Chuo 2-chome, Fukui) that sells meal delivery robots said, "Due to the impact of the coronavirus, the shortage of staff at restaurants in the prefecture has become serious, and there has been a lot of inquiries about introducing robots."
Hoshiyama said, "I think that it will become even more difficult to secure employees at suburban stores in the future, and that the use of meal delivery robots will increase."

The ending note of Echizen town is 35 pages.

There is also a column to write a message to loved ones and a column to write down things you want to do in the rest of your life.
I have 35 pages to write, but I don't have to fill all the pages.
What do you want to leave behind for your family and the people around you?

Chorus, sports classes, and club activities will be held without masks as a general rule.

Toba City to double child-rearing household allowance, seeks repayment - Ise Newspaper

【Toba】Toba City announced on the 10th that there were 60,000 yen of mistaken payments to 12 people in 11 households in the child-rearing household life support special allowance (other household allowance) for the Reiwa 3rd year.
The city is asking the residents to return the money, while apologizing and explaining the circumstances.
According to the city, the case was discovered on January 27, 2020, after the guardian of a child who had previously received benefits pointed out the discrepancy.

According to the confirmation of 182 people in 79 households who were eligible for the grant in the same year, it was found that the grant was paid twice to 12 people in 11 households on July 20, 2020.
The city will pay a benefit of 50,000 yen per child under the age of high school students in households exempt from residential tax.

The data was provided by the contracted computer company, which extracted the target children from the data, but the staff member mistakenly added the data of high school students, who were not included in the data, and paid twice.
The person in charge of the city's childcare support room said, "We will take this seriously, recheck the data, and strive to prevent recurrence and regain trust."

Introduction to the forefather of plant research, and the collection of data from Mount Hayachine. Exhibition at the city's comprehensive cultural property center. [Hakamaki] Iwanichi Online, Iwanichinichishinsha

The exhibition "People who introduced the flowers of Mount Hayachine - A brief history of the plant research of Mount Hayachine" which was held at the city's comprehensive cultural property center in Ohasama, Hanamaki, until the 12th, was an exhibition that introduced the pioneers who built the foundation of the plant research of Mount Hayachine, which is known as a treasure trove of alpine plants.
He has collected 124 items, including precious specimens collected by his predecessors, and introduced the footprints of his predecessors who were involved in the plant research of Mount Hayachine.

The study of plants on Mount Hayachine began with the arrival of Russian plant researcher Karl Johann Maximovich (1827-91) in the late Edo period, and with the collection of plants under his guidance by Sugawa Chonosuke (1842-1925), who was born in Shiwa Town.
Maximovitch, who was not allowed to freely walk around the country for foreigners, asked for an interview in Sugawa and continued his research for three years with Yokohama and Nagasaki as his base.
After returning from the Maximo Vitch, Shukawa continued to support research, and as a result, the "Himekozakura", "Namboutouuchi-sou", and "Miyamayamabuki-shouma" of Mount Hayachine were announced.

After that, the modern plant taxonomist Makino Tomitaro (1862-1957) published "Bistorta hayachinensis", "Cobano tsukesu", "Draba japonica", and "Arenaria katoana" in 1903 (Meiji 36) based on the local researchers' collection, and named and discovered them himself on Mount Hayachine in 1905 (Meiji 38).
From the exhibition materials, it is clear that many researchers have discovered valuable alpine plants.

Also introduced are Sakemura Makuzo (1874-1948), who was the principal of Hakamachi Elementary School and conducted plant research while participating in the survey for the preservation of natural monuments in 1927 (Showa 2), and Yokawa Nanoru (1914-1988), who was a teacher at the Hasama Mountain Museum and contributed to the publication of "Sakuragawa Peak Plants".

Yoshida Masahiro, a researcher at the center, said, "There are many studies and connections between people behind the names of plants in Mount Hayachine. It is possible to trace the connections between researchers from local to national level."

The exhibition is divided into four chapters, with the first chapter focusing on the faith and history of Mount Hayachine, and the second chapter focusing on the geological features of Mount Hayachine, with a spotlight on the research of German geologist Edmund Naumann, who laid the foundation for Japanese geology.

The "Amami Airport Decarbonization Promotion Council" (Chairman: Aoki Shun, Chief of the Ōshima Subprefectural Office Construction Section, 13 members), which is composed of the prefecture and airlines that use Amami Airport (Kasari, Amami City), held its second meeting at the airport on the 9th, in order to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
All members are present, including online.
The opinions were exchanged on the setting of decarbonization goals and the introduction of renewable energy, with solar power generation as the mainstay.

The Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism has set a goal to reduce greenhouse gas emissions at all airports by 46% or more by 2030, in order to achieve "carbon neutrality" by 2050, which means zero greenhouse gas emissions.
In response to this, the council held its first meeting last November, and is aiming to plan and prepare for the other six airports in the prefecture.
The second meeting will be held in camera, as was the first, except for the opening.
According to Ando, chairman of the meeting, the greenhouse gas emissions of the airport will be confirmed at the meeting.
In order to set goals and introduce renewable energy, they have been conducting negotiations in accordance with the guidelines of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
According to the distribution materials, the CO2 emissions of the airport facilities and vehicles in the fiscal year 2013, which served as the benchmark, were 1,476 tons (excluding aircraft).

Among them, the lighting and air conditioning of the airport terminal building and six other facilities account for about 93% of the total emissions, followed by the aviation lighting of 1321 tons and the airport vehicles of 711 tons.
The council will discuss reducing emissions from these facilities and vehicles.
Chairman Ando said, "We are now at the point of passing the bill. The direction of the committee is in agreement, and I want to make sure that we thoroughly compile the interim report."
In the future, the third meeting will be held to hear the interim report, and the fourth meeting will be held to hear the final report, and the plan will be promoted.
